op.title: Red Sonora BOOK REVIEW THREAD
op.body: I enjoyed it. Well-argued overall, but I knew everything it said already because I actually pay attention to the world. Still a good read for teenagers.

replies.body: Thinly-veiled advertisement thread. Aren't you the resident communist? And yet your promoting a book that people... purchase! The hypocricy is astounding.
I think Brandes is right in that we're going to be looking at Mexico for a long time. That was the moment that the pretense was dropped.
It's a partisan hackjob masquerading as political analysis. Anybody could tell you that the war in Mexico was bad

Willnotbetelevised, I was around for the war in Mexico. I called my congressman about it, I believe it was Davis at the time. As I'm sure you know, they never declared war. It was called a security operation right up to the end. To my mind, it was Mexico and the Europe situation that made folks at home see how bad the oil problem was. A good friend of mine was arrested by the Un-American Activities Force, he was born in America but his parents were Mexican. I never found out what happened to him. I will have to pick up a copy of this book and give it a read. Gramps.

He's not just saying the war is bad, you fat pig. The argument is that the annexation of Mexico kickstarted a global shift away from liberalism. Apparently they don't teach reading comprehension in Fatsville Tennessee.
